Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c their code will prevent the "self-healing" that we saw in the emc2 attack, where old nodes jumped back to the correct dpow chain, because the re-org would be too large. Their code makes it so the attacker can split the network and then it requires a massive amount of manual work to reconcile forks. Sounds like one of the worst kinds of cryptocoin DoS's

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Just a bit of background for everyone, @mrdotboson is thinking of using KMD instead of a ERC20 token but their dev has some questions. @SHossain who did the IOS app? Was it @pbca26 ?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Yes it was pbca who made the ios version of Agama too.

Author: mrdotboson#5783
Content:
Hey pondsea, thanks for inviting me here! Cool to connect with so much talent in one channel. Yes, weâ€™re considering replacing our ERC20 and were wondering how exactly we would make the payment gateway work if we used Komodo instead of Ethereum. At the moment, weâ€™re just considering and making sure we know all the facts so we can make a more informed decision. 

Essentially, what weâ€™re doing is creating a payment gateway for our coin on our IOS app. A user inputs their address (x) and the number of tokens they are transferring (y) before making a transfer. App then checks if a payment has been received in our wallet (z) by x address with y tokens. If yes, payment is considered successful. 

There is no wallet built into the app. I am not entirely sure how weâ€™re doing this with Ethereum, Maxim would be in a better position to answer that, but I believe weâ€™re using EtherScan APIs. Our question would be if we were using Komodo, what exactly would the process involve and how exactly can we make this work

Author: IamLegion#7781
Content: @mrdotboson from the sound of it you're using a web-based API to interact with chain information. Any coin could do that as long as it had a stable web-based API at an address you could access

Author: IamLegion#7781
Content: Through an API your token information could be recorded in transactions on the KMD blockchain the same way that Komodo uses Bitcoin to secure it

Author: IamLegion#7781
Content: With the right form of encoding and decoding transaction information is surprisingly versatile

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: doesn't sound difficult if no wallet in the app, just an RPC call or web api to interact with.   Probably already using a 3rd party like coinpayments or netcoins or something.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: all of them - if your definition of "seeking" is broad.   otherwise, i haven't a clue sorry ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: AWS offers many levels of partnership.  the one that got announced by some other project last week and published on coindesk was not a "world first".  not to water down their achievement - congratulations.   but komodo already has engagement with AWS and funding provided for specific testing on their platform.  most of the bigger news sites run on a pay-to-play basis to get content published, so it's quite likely it was a paid for article to appease investors

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
```test@testnode:~/staked/StakedModo/src$ ./komodo-cli -ac_name=TEST setpubkey 02f7597468703c1c5c8465dd6d43acaae697df9df30bed21494d193412a1ea193e
{
  "address": "RWHGbrLSP89fTzNVF9U9xiekDYJqcibTca",
  "ismine": false,
  "pubkey": "02f7597468703c1c5c8465dd6d43acaae697df9df30bed21494d193412a1ea193e"
}
```

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There we go... this looks pretty perfect... You can now set the pubkey with an RPC, it wont allow setting an invlaid pubkey and will also tell you if the address is imported.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This should allow dAPPs to be made about 1000x easier I will submit PR to FSM with this change, as its very much needed to make develpoment and UX better/easier.
